meanings.definition: A utensil with a long handle and a deep bowl for serving or transferring food.
meanings.sent1: I used a scoop to serve ice cream at the party.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a scoop to transfer the soup into a bowl.
meanings.sent3: The scoop fell into the cake batter, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a scoop, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The scoop gleamed in the sunlight, inviting me to use it.

meanings.definition: To pick up or gather something with a scoop.
meanings.sent1: I will scoop some sand to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent2: She likes to scoop up seashells along the shore.
meanings.sent3: He tried to scoop the clouds from the sky, but they slipped through his fingers.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner seemed to scoop up all the dirt in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The excavator can scoop large amounts of soil effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A piece of news or information obtained and published before anyone else.
meanings.sent1: The journalist got the scoop on the upcoming movie release.
meanings.sent2: She shared the scoop about the new restaurant opening downtown.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have the scoop on the neighbor's secret activities.
meanings.sent4: The detective finally uncovered the scoop on the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: Getting the scoop first made her feel like a professional reporter.
